_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:32:11 using v2.7
title: Do people feel supported to manage their long-term condition(s)?
analysis_commentary:
When asked in the GP patient survey 'In the last 6 months, have you had enough support from local services or organisations (not just health services) to help you to manage your long-term health condition(s)?' the majority of patients responded positively in all time points; the total proportion of patients responding either 'yes, definitely' or 'yes, to some extent' has always been above 50%. There was an increase in those reporting positively from 2010/11 to 2011/12; where the total responding 'yes' increased by 10.4% in a year. Since then these trends have been stable and in July 2015, 38.6% felt they 'yes, definitely' had enough support and 24.7% felt 'yes, to some extent' had enough support.

The trend is in the right direction, but it is worth noting that there were still more than 1 in 10 patients (12.4% in July 2015) stating that they didn't feel the had enough support to manage their long-term condition(s) in the last 6 months.
